body: ANOTHER THING WOULD BE: If a husband gives money to his wife with chronic alcoholism so that she goes out on the street. She then ends up dead in a bar. Here it does seem to me that there is a responsibility because alcoholism or drug addiction are vices that stem from compulsions (and compulsions are practically uncontrollable for a person). But if the person is unfaithful, then it is only their responsibility. It is evident that this asshole could have prevented it: that she sleeps with the Fuckboy. But he trusted her and that was his mistake. But that doesn't make him guilty of the wife's decisions and how it all ended.

I don't see him as a culprit, but I see him as a jerk: someone who trusted a whore. Yeah, possibly the guy thought she was going to fuck the Fuckboy, but unlike us (ubiquitous reader), this jerk didn't see him as a danger to their relationship. From our (global) perspective we knew that she was about to reach the mental break (and that she would be the eternal slave of the Fuckboy), but from the husband's point of view: his wife was still faithful and rather believed that his wife would go back and share the money with him. He could have foreseen it, YES. But this does not make him guilty of someone else's decisions, especially when this person said the opposite (that she loves the husband more).
